resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.description:
Currently email link tracking is turned on in Sendgrid, so links redirect through them & we can view our click statistics through them.

This should be altered to instead link directly to the app with custom parameters that can then be sent to Google Analytics.

fields.summary: User email preferences cannot be turned off

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
There are two issues here:
1. You cant turn off email notifications. I expect to see no notifications if I unselect the option in the accounts detail page.
2. By default, we notify users by email when a story is shared with them, however in the account details the choice is unchecked. If the default is to send notifications, then this option should be checked by default.

fields.summary: Space before login names will cause error page to show up

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
When you are logging in if there a space before the login name, the app will take you to the error page with the vanilla message ("You've found a problem we haven't solved yet. Sorry about that."). 

This behavior is seen even if the login is not valid, so you can try 
user:   s 
(note the space before the s)
password: <empty>

It should instead show the standard error message for incorrect user name/password.

fields.description: When adding and removing tags from a story I have been unable to delete tags that contain only numbers. I cannot remove tags "2012" or "2013" but tags "1980-2018" can be removed. Tags that combine letters and numbers can also be deleted.

fields.summary: Admin: User invite url is incorrect when using a different login name

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
The url sent to users contains a link to the wrong user reference if you create a user login that is different from the email id. 

Clicking on the url will take you to the account update screen of the user whose email was used.

For e.g. 

I created a user with login name "test-user" and used my email. When creating the user, I choose to send out email invite (there is no other way to send invite because of other issues).

When I click on the url in the email I received, I am taken to my account page, instead of "test-users"s account

fields.summary: Admin email invite does not use correct login name (uses email instead)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
If you are creating a user that has login name different than the user name, the email invite that goes out uses the wrong field to populate.

e.g. create a user with name "bob", email: some_bob@foo.com.

The email invite will have the following content, so the user will not know about the login id and cannot login.

Greetings Bob,

Welcome to ClearStory Data!

Your user name is: some_bob@foo.com

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Ability to send test emails to Litmus
fields.description:
Litmus (http://litmus.com) is an email testing platform that allows you to view delivered emails rendered in a variety of email clients. It's very powerful & easy to use & I've had a great experience with it in the past.

Our transactional email is currently barebones enough that multi-client testing is not essential. That said, it would be a good thing to have, & may become necessary as our emails grow in sophistication, so capturing.

fields.description: When a user is notified that they've been added to a story, the email should contain a list of other users who are collaborators on the story.

fields.summary: Emails need indication of Login Name and Organization
fields.description:
Reminder:  Now that accounts can have the same email address, but different login names, we need to distinguish which account the email was intended.

e.g.
Login Name: csd_admin@groupm.com 
Email: support@clearstorydata.com
Organization: GroupM

Login Name: csd_admin@sc.com
Email: support@clearstorydata.com
Organization: StandardCharter

We need any emails sent to specify the Login Name and Organization in the body of the text for clarity.

fields.summary: User can reset password using self-directed flow
fields.description:
We all know how this works:

1) User clicks Forgot password? link from app
2) User sees screen where they enter email address (login name?)
3) User is assigned a random reset password token via catalog
4) Email is sent to user containing a link with this token
5) Upon visiting page via this link, token is verified via catalog
6) User can enter new password & confirmation
7) New password is persisted & reset password token removed

fields.summary: Enable Mailtrap for shared development environments

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
The letter_opener gem used to preview emails in local development does not work using remote machines. For dev, fedev, staging, etc we need a way to verify emails attempted to send & view their content.

http://mailtrap.io/ seems the most versatile way of doing this.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.description:
Environment:  Production
Browser:  Chrome

The story actions menu is not dismissing as I expect.  When I click Save as Default, the menu stays active, and it seems I need to click off the menu altogether to dismiss it.

fields.summary: User is notified by email when comment is added to story

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
If a user has expressed interest in a story (read: is subscribed), they should be notified when a new comment is added to that story.

To begin with, "interest" will be recorded when they participate in a discussion for a story.

Dependent on support for user-story subscriptions. See CAT-152 & CAT-153.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Fixed

fields.summary: User is notified by email when new discussion created on a story they belong to

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.description:
For now, notify all collaborators on a story when a new discussion is created.

Eventually this might be tied to user-story subscriptions.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Fixed

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.description:
Model methods/attributes to support user-story subscriptions.
Dependent on CAT-153

user.stories
user.subscribe(story_id)
user.unsubscribe(story_id)

story.subscribed_users
